TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/click the continue button to start the experiment.
A 5000 microlitre pipette is taken from pipette stand.
Adjust its volume to 5000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The lid of the PBS buffer bottle is opened and 5000 microlitre of buffer is taken from the bottle.
The centrifuge tube labeled as IgG antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the PBS buffer is added to it.
The IgG labeled tube is placed back on the rack.
A butter paper is taken from the lab table.
The butter paper is placed on the weighing balance and the balance is tared.
The lid of the antibody bottle is opened and a small amount of antibody is taken.
The IgG antibody powder is added to the butter paper placed on the weighing balance.0.1g of antibody is weighed.
The centrifuge tube labeled as IgG antibody which contain PBS buffer is taken from the rack.
The IgG antibody is added to the vial.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
A micropipette is taken from the rack.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh pipette is inserted.
1000 microlitre of 0.1M cysteine solution is pippeted out from the beaker.
The centrifuge tube with antibody solution is taken from the vial.
0.1 M cysteine solution is added to the vial.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The used tip is discarded to a beaker.
The 1000 microlitre pipette is placed back on the stand and a 20 microlitre pipette is taken from the stand.
Adjust the pipette to 20 microlitres.
A fresh tip is inserted.
20 microlitre of 0.5 M EDTA solution is taken from the beaker.
The tube labeled as IgG antibody is taken from the rack.
20microlitre of 0.5 M EDTA solution is added to the centrifuge tube.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
A butter paper is placed on a weighing balance (mg) and the balance is tared.
A clean spatula is taken from the lab table.
The cap of the Papain bottle is opened and a small amount of Papain is taken.
Then the Papain powder is added to the butter paper placed on the weighing balance. 1mg of Papain is weighed.
The tube labeled as IgG antibody is taken from the rack.
The Papain powder is added to the tube.
The contents in the tube are properly mixed by shaking.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The tube containing IgG antibody-Papain solution is taken from the bench top.
The door of the incubator is opened and the tube is placed on it.
The door of the incubator is opened and the tube is placed on it.
The door of the incubator is opened and the tube is placed on it.
The incubator door is closed.
The tube is incubated at 37 degree Celsius for 4 hours.
After 4 hours the tube is taken from the incubator and the incubator door is closed.
After 4 hours the tube is taken from the incubator and the incubator door is closed.
After 4 hours the tube is taken from the incubator and the incubator door is closed.
The tube is placed on the bench top.
DIALYSIS
A forceps is taken from the lab table.
A small piece of dialysis tubing is taken from the Ethanol Storage Solution using the forceps.
The dialysis tubing is washed using the distilled water.
The bottle is placed back on the table.
A clamp is taken from the bench top.
The clamp is inserted on the dialysis tubing at one side.
The dialysis tubing is placed over the tissue paper on the bench top.
A 10 ml pipette is inserted to the pipette pump.
The tube labeled as IgG antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the IgG antibody-Papain solution is pippeted out using 10 ml pipette.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The dialysis tubing is taken and it is filled using the IgG antibody-Papain solution.
The air present in the dialysing tube is squeezed out and the clamp is inserted.
The dialysis tubing containing the solution is placed on the tissue paper and it is wiped gently using another tissue paper.
The dialysis tubing with IgG antibody-Papain solution is placed on the 0.01M sodium acetate Buffer.
The magnetic Teflon is also placed in the 0.01M sodium acetate buffer using a forceps.
The beaker containing 0.01M Sodium acetate buffer solution is taken from the bench top.
The beaker is placed on the magnetic stirrer which is placed inside the Visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and it is kept for overnight at 4 degree Celsius.
After overnight incubation, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing 0.01 M sodium acetate buffer solution is taken out.
The beaker is placed back on the bench top and the dialysis tubing containing IgG antibody-Papain solution is taken from the beaker.
The clamp is taken off from one side of the dialysis tubing.
The solution from the dialysis tubing is pipetted out using a Pasteur pipette.
The centrifuge tube labeled ad Dialysed Antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the dialysed IgG antibody-Papain solution is added to it.
The tube is replaced on the rack.
The bottle containing distilled water is taken from the lab table.
The chromatographic column is washed with distilled water.
After proper washing, the bottle is placed back on the lab table.
The CM Cellulose slurry is transferred into the column.
The CM Cellulose slurry is transferred into the column.
The beaker containing the CM –cellulose slurry is placed back in the table.
0.01 M sodium acetate buffer bottle is taken from the lab table.
The buffer is poured into the column.
The buffer in the column is removed into a waste beaker by removing the cap. The column is then recapped.
The centrifuge tube containing dialysed antibody is taken from the rack.
The dialysed antibody from the tube is poured into the column.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
0.01M sodium acetate buffer is taken from the bench top.
The buffer is again poured into the column.
The centrifuge tube labeled as Purified sample 1 is taken from the stand.
The tube is placed on another stand.
Then the tube is placed under the chromatographic column and its cap is removed.
The cap of the column is removed and the solution is collected in the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The cap of the column is removed and the solution is collected in the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube is then closed and placed it back on the rack.
The centrifuge tube is then closed and placed it back on the rack.
notext
The bottle containing distilled water is taken from the lab table.
The chromatographic column is washed with distilled water.
After proper washing, the bottle is placed back on the lab table.
The DEAE Cellulose slurry is transferred into the column.
The DEAE Cellulose slurry is transferred into the column.
0.01 M sodium acetate buffer bottle is taken from the lab table.
The buffer is poured into the column.
The buffer in the column is removed into a waste beaker by removing the cap .Then the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube containing purified sample1 is taken from the rack.
The purified sample from the tube is poured into the column.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
0.01M sodium acetate buffer is taken from the bench top.
The buffer is again poured into the column.
The centrifuge tube labeled as Purified sample 2 is taken from the stand.
The tube is placed on another stand.
The tube is placed under the chromatographic column and its cap is removed.
The cap of the column is removed and the solution is collected in the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The cap of the column is removed and the solution is collected in the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube is then closed and placed it back on the rack.
The centrifuge tube is then closed and placed it back on the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
1000 microlitre of 0.01 M sodium acetate buffer is pippeted out from the beaker.
A cuvette for blank (labeled as B) is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of 0.01 M sodium acetate buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette B is placed back on the rack.
Again 1000 microlitre of 0.01M sodium acetate buffer is taken from the beaker.
Another B labeled cuvette (for Blank) is taken from the rack.
0.01M sodium acetate buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette is placed back on the rack.
The lid of spectrophotometer is opened.
One of the B labeled cuvette is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is properly wiped using a tissue paper.
After that the cuvette is placed in one of the slit in the spectrophotometer.
The second cuvette labeled as B is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is wiped properly using a tissue paper.
The second cuvette is placed in the other slit in the spectrophotometer and the lid is closed.
The spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.
This is the graph indicating the baseline which is observed on the monitor.
The lid of the spectrophotometer is opened and one of the cuvette is taken out from it.
The cuvette labeled as B is replaced on the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The tube labeled as purified sample 2 is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of sample is pipetted out from it.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The cuvette labeled as T (Test cuvette) is taken from the rack.
The purified sample 2 is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette is wiped properly using the tissue paper.
The cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer and is closed.
The spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.
The resultant graph is observed on the monitor.
DIALYSIS OF PURIFIED SAMPLE 2 IN PBS BUFFER.
A forceps is taken from the lab table.
A small piece of dialysis tubing is taken from the Ethanol Storage Solution using the forceps.
The dialysis tubing is washed using the distilled water.
A clamp is taken from the bench top.
The clamp is inserted on the dialysis tubing at one side.
The dialysis tubing is placed over the tissue paper on the bench top.
A 10 ml pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The tube labeled as Purified Sample 2 is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the entire solution is pippeted out using 10 ml pipette.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The dialysis tubing is taken and it is filled using purified sample 2 solutions.
The air present in the dialysing tube is squeezed out and the clamp is inserted.
The dialysis tubing containing the solution is placed on the tissue paper and it is wiped gently using another tissue paper.
The dialysis tubing with purified sample 2 is placed on the PBS Buffer.
The magnetic Teflon is also placed in the PBS buffer using a forceps.
The beaker containing PBS buffer solution is taken from the bench top.
The beaker is placed on the magnetic stirrer which is placed inside the Visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and it is kept for overnight at 4 degree Celsius.
After overnight incubation, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing PBS buffer solution is taken out.
The beaker is placed back on the bench top and the dialysis tubing containing purified sample is taken from the beaker.
The clamp is taken off from one side of the dialysis tubing.
The solution from the dialysis tubing is pipetted out using a Pasteur pipette.
The tube labeled as Purified F(ab) fragments is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the Purified F(ab) fragments is added to it.The centrifuge tube contain Purified F(ab) fragment solution.
The centrifuge tube is replaced on the rack.
A 10 ml pipette is taken from the stand and is inserted into a pipette pump.
The cap of the 50% glycerol bottle is opened and 5 ml of the glycerol is pippeted out.
A cryovial is taken from the cryobox.
5 ml of 50% glycerol is transferred to the cryovial.
The cryovial is replaced on the box.
The tube containing Purified F(ab) fragments is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and 5 ml of purified F(ab) fragment solution is pipetted out.
The tube is replaced on the rack.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The cap of the vial is opened and pour the solution into it.
The cryovial is replaced on the cryobox.
A piece of parafilm is cut from the parafilm roll.
The outer cover is removed.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The vial is wrapped with parafilm properly.
The wrapped cryovial which contain the sample is placed on the cryobox.
The -20 degree Freezer is opened and the cryobox with vial is kept in the freezer.
The door of the freezer is closed.
